title.narrative: Leading Urban Change In Rahovec Through Revitalization Of The Central City Square

description.narrative:
Based on the initial concept note this project document was developed in directresponse to the municipality of Rahovec willing to advance sustainable development of the municipality through strategic, comprehensive and inclusive planning processes and informed decision-making vis-à-vis capital investment projects; collaborate on enhancing opportunities for the citizens and the civil and business community to engage directly with local decision-makers and to contribute to the formulation of strategic public responses to key issues; and ultimately improve living conditions for citizens.The request came in recognition of UN-Habitat's expertise in the field of spatial and urban planning, and its long engagement as a trusted international partner in municipal institution and capacity building in Kosovo, including with the municipality of Rahovec.A Memorandum of Understanding was signed in May 2019 between UN-Habitat Kosovo Office and the municipality of Rahovec to start framing the collaboration around spatial planning support and public space development and management, and citizen dialogue.
Local Priorities: The project responds to acute needs and strategic orientations reflected in the Municipal Development Plan (2018-2026 +) of Rahovec municipality.
National Priorities: The project is aligned and supports the realisation of the 2016-21 National Development Strategy (in which inclusive development is a sub-theme) and the 2015-2020 Strategy for Modernization of Public Administration (which includes transparent and responsible public administration with a clear accountability system as well as continuous information of citizens on development and delivery of public services, on their rights and how they can be realized).
Global Priorities: The project helps moving Kosovo institutions and communities localizing the Sustainable Development Goals, especially Goals 11 and 16 but also 5, 8, 10 and 13. This reflects well discussions being held within the UN family in Kosovo and may be further integrated in the upcoming United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) for Kosovo.
The project will build on UN-Habitat's principles and approaches in terms of inclusive planning and sustainable local governance and the results and toolsgenerated by the Municipal Spatial Planning Support Programme in Kosovo and Block by Block initiatives which supported efficient management of local governments through capacity-building programmes and on-the-job assistance, notably in terms of participatory spatial planning processes as well as public space design and delivery. The project will act as a substantive continuum and keep fueling the experiences and lessons learned by the UN-Habitat Kosovo Office. The project will trigger good practices and lessons learned from the tools developed for the Kosovo context, i.e. ‘Turning spaces into places’, ‘Guidelines for gender mainstreaming in spatial planning’, and other relevant experiences and action-research i.e. ‘Public Space Profile of Pristina’ and ‘Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan guidelines’. Finally, the project will be using dedicated tools developed by the Global Public Space Programme with a view to quickly assess both city-wide public space and the delineated area for the competition (particularly within Phase 1).

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: A planning and design solution for the central city square providing an access to safe, healthy and inclusive green & public spaces, in particular for women and children, elderly and persons with disabilities, and creating job and business opportunities

title.narrative: A design proposal for the central city square matching sustainability requirements and community adherence

title.narrative: Durably capacitated municipal departments with knowledge, tools and experience to conduct participatory, transparent and responsive urban planning and design mechanisms, and a successful design competition process and a public dialogue around public space and urban regeneration

description.narrative: Durably capacitated municipal departments with knowledge, tools and experience to conduct participatory, transparent and responsive urban planning and design mechanisms, and a successful design competition process and a public dialogue around public space and urban regeneration

title.narrative: Performing municipal planning structures and mechanism for inclusive and transparent planning and design processes in place and ready for up-scaling or replication

description.narrative: Performing municipal planning structures and mechanism for inclusive and transparent planning and design processes in place and ready for up-scaling or replication

baseline.value: Weak and unstructured municipal capacities to conduct, implement and monitor spatial, urban planning and design processes; No standing mechanism to support outreach, transparent, and inclusive planning processes; modest practices of participatory approaches for decisions affecting regional and local development and constituencies

target.value: Municipal Planning team (MPT) established and functional; at least 12 municipal officials are engaged and capacitated; Two participatory tools (state-citizens dialogue and competition, incl. community prize) , mechanisms implemented and institutionalized that support outreach, public engagement, transparent, gender & age &mobile sensitive and inclusive planning processes
